=== END NODE ===

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_WarlockProposal_Warlock.lsj
Synopsis:
However this scene plays out, the warlock is enigmatic and self-assured - she saves players and then departs, hinting toward the help that her master can offer in other similar situations. Players have been captured by the goblin priestess and could not escape their chains. After they rest, the priestess returns to see if they've transformed into mind flayers (as she expected) and is disappointed to see they haven't. She intends to kill them, but a warlock intervenes and saves the players, killing the priestess. The warlock has been sent by its master, a cambion called The Monitor, who players may have met already.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_VoloBallad_Volo_FestivitiesArea.lsj
Synopsis:
Volo, a reknowned scholar, has been captured by goblins and is being forced to sing on a stage at their celebratory party following a raid. One goblin has the responsibility of guarding him and engages him in conversation. If the goblins are killed, he investigates the corpses, researching the cause of death.

Synopsis:
Conversation with an adventurer who has been tortured. The player may or may not have participated in the torture. The adventurer is hurt, tired, and broken. Note for mocap recording: the tortured adventurer can say most of his lines chained on a bed or free (standing up). Please record everything standing up. Cinematics will handle the lying down state.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_QuartermasterFlimsy.lsj
Synopsis:
A trader from the Zhentarim (z-HENT-ah-rim) , a shady organisation of spies, assassins and dealers in illicit goods. The player may or may not recognise her as such, but either way her attitude is blunt, breezy and unscrupulous. She's there to make money, and you're either there to make a deal or wasting her time - she has absolutely no interest in indecision or moralizing.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_PainPriest_Penance.lsj
Synopsis:
This occurs as Abdirak is beating the player. Breathless with excitement. Reveling in the act of penance - think preacher in 'god will save us, save us ALL!' mode as he, well, beats the crap out of the player. All of his reactions should be manic, joyous and vaguely sexual. Player is in front of him, facing a wall as he raises his weapon and beats the player. The weapon will be either a dagger, handaxe or a scourge.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_PainPriest_DuringPenance.lsj
Synopsis:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening and creepy edge.

0:0 - Come now, dear child. It is time to repent.

> What do you want me to do?
> I've changed my mind.

uid: fedd7836-3cf6-fc17-1612-12cf12900d52
> null

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_Orpheus_VoiceOfAbsolute.lsj
Synopsis:
Before entering the goblin camp, a scene triggers in which the party hear the voice of the Absolute, and experience a vision of its Chosen Three (Ketheric, Gortash and Orin). The voice orders the player to help the three find the Orpheus artefact and to seek 'the path of illumination'. If a party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory, they take it into their hands. It glows brighter and brighter, and then the voice and visions stop. The light from the box then fades, and the player(s) discuss the apparent protection the box provided from the Absolutes influence. If no party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory,and Shadowheart isn't alive to show up, the visions and voice will cause the party to pass out and experience a forced camp night where they receive the box. NOTE: this dialogue contains narrator nodes that're intended to be player-forward in the medium term until NPC assets are available for cinematics.

0:0 - *Then, there are three figures before you. An armoured male elf, exuding power and command. A handsome younger man with a quick, easy smile. And a pale young woman with even paler eyes...*

> These are my Chosen. They speak for me.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_GuardPolite.lsj
Synopsis:

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_GoblinPriest_Chapel.lsj
Synopsis:
The goblin priestess is branding new converts to the cult of the Absolute. She is a True Soul - tadpoled, but unaware that is the case. She believes she is communing directly with the Absolute. She's one of three leaders in the goblin camp, and an important and powerful member of the Absolute's cult. She's charismatic and friendly, in a crude sort of way, but has an underlying suspicion and curiosity. Her offers of help are really a ploy to separate players from their friends so that she can imprison them and watch as the parasite eats them alive.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_GoblinPriest_ChainedCharacter.lsj
Synopsis:
Players wake from a sleeping spell/potion to find themselves chained, captive, in a cellar. The last thing they remember is accepting help from the goblin priestess, who has now captured them. She is sadistic and takes great pleasure in explaining that they're going to become mindflayers due to the parasite in their head, and that she's going to keep them trapped here until that happens. Barbarian characters can break free at the end if they succeed a strength check. Combat with Gut ensues.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_GoblinPriest_Branding.lsj
Synopsis:
The sadistic goblin priestess is branding new converts to the cult of the Absolute. She is a True Soul - tadpoled, but unaware that is the case. She believes she is communing directly with the Absolute. She's one of three leaders in the goblin camp, and an important and powerful member of the Absolute's cult. She's cruel and has a sense of superiority over her own kind. Her offers of help are really a ploy to separate players from their friends so that she can imprison them and watch as the parasite eats them alive.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_GoblinPriestOgre.lsj
Synopsis:
An ogre that acts as a guard in the goblin priestess' chapel. Will warn players away if they enter the chapel area - will attack them if they escape from the priestess' dungeon.

0:0 - You. Not supposed to be here. Leave!
uid: 69e64410-b525-213d-8f11-c9eb96ae1596

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_GoblinKing_Scrying.lsj
Synopsis:
The goblin king is about to conduct a ceremony in which he speak's with a mind flayer's dead body. He is a hobgoblin on a power trip, but still devoted to his god The Absolute. Like most goblins, he's not greatly intelligent, but a cut above the rest. Pronunciation: Dror Ragzlin = Drawer RAGS-lin. Z'Rell = Zuh-RELL. Other prinunciations in actor node field. Goblin language words should sound guttural and trashy. When they engage with Ragzlin, the player will experience a brief vision of him with an elf - this is teasing Ketheric Thorm, a later antagonist. Ragzlin will say he's looking for a weapon - the place will realise via narrator or mindmeld with Shadowheart that this is the gith artefact that she has.

uid: 00078fb1-50df-3efd-6b10-a5519ff998b1

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_GoblinKing_Dead.lsj
Synopsis:
The player interrogates Dror Ragzlin's corpse about Z'Rell, Halsin, and Moonrise Towers. His N+1 info means he can be forced to talk even if the player killed him.

0:0 - Why does the Absolute want the fugitives?

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_Festivities_DwarfOperator000.lsj
Synopsis:
This goblin is wearing a pair of fancy breeches he stole off a dead dwarf. A dead dwarf that he's currently helping to cook, on a spit. The breeches have a poem inside that contains a clue the players might need to open a dungeon inside the goblin camp, but Klagga is unaware of this. He'd rather admire his own fashion sense and flirt than figure out what the poem means, and he can be convinced to sell it or give it away.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_DrowCommander.lsj
Synopsis:
The drow commander is a True Soul, sent to the goblin camp in order to instil some discipline in the goblins and lead their raids. She's already had one success - at the tavern - but the adventurers who infiltrated the goblin camp are her next targets. The Absolute believes they have something of value, and she must reclaim it. The players can tell her that the adventurers fled to the grove in which case she'll see the players as perfect candidates to help her infiltrate the place, having mistaken them for True Souls.

Jump to another node

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch0_Hotfix3_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_DrowAndCaptured_ThreeWayDialog.lsj
Synopsis:
The players approach the drow commander at the goblin camp, escorted by a goblin who they rescued from a nearby druid grove. The drow is seeking that grove and upon learning its location from the goblin will prepare to raid it, demanding that the player help. If the goblin recognises that the player is a True Soul - a figure of authority - her life will be spared. If she does not recognise this, the drow will execute her unless the player intervenes on her behalf.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Act1\Goblin\GOB_ChickenChase_Owlbear.lsj
Synopsis:
This owlbear has been captured by the goblins. It is a cub and has been tormented by the goblins. In this dialog the player can reassure it, guide it to safety, or encourage it to attack the goblins. If the player has convinced his captors to release him, they can invite him to their camp. The owlbear refuses - but will show up later on his own.

This goblin is a commentator on the much-loved goblin sport of chicken-chasing, which involves chasing a chicken (or later, a much larger owlbear) through a set of posts to score a 'chicken-strike'. She's fanatically devoted to the sport, and expects the same dedication from everyone. She'll invite the player to take part, but only if you make a bet.

Synopsis:
If the player released the captured goblin in Halsin's den, the CG will be waiting for the player at the checkpoint. When the player starts the dialog with the main guard at the checkpoint (or gets closer to him) and the CG is at the checkpoint, this dialog is shown. After this dialog, the CG leaves the checkpoint and the main guard gets his normal dialog back. Olak and Sazza have a very antagonistic relationship, ripping each other to shreds.
